question.title: What are the possible values of the Hibernate hbm2ddl.auto configuration and what do they do
question.body:
I really want to know more about the update, export and the values that could be given to hibernate.hbm2ddl.auto
I need to know when to use the update and when not? And what is the alternative?

These are changes that could happen over DB:

  • new tables
  • new columns in old tables
  • columns deleted
  • data type of a column changed
  • a type of a column changed its attributes
  • tables dropped
  • values of a column changed

In each case what is the best solution?

answers.body:
hibernate hbm2ddl auto (hibernate.hbm2ddl.auto)

  • none - In runtime if Hibernate find mismatch between DB's schema and App's Entities it throws Exception

For example, you add a new field in Entity:

org.hibernate.exception.SQLGrammarException: JDBC exception executing SQL [ERROR: column c1_0.cvv2 does not exist

  • validate - When the App is started, Hibernate check a DB's schema with Entities in the App. If they are different, you get an error in compile time and the App will not be run

For example, you add a new field in Entity:

org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanCreationException: Error creating bean with name 'entityManagerFactory' defined in class path resource [org/springframework/boot/hibernate/autoconfigure/HibernateJpaConfiguration.class]: Unable to build Hibernate SessionFactory [persistence unit: default] ; nested exception is org.hibernate.tool.schema.spi.SchemaManagementException: Schema-validation: missing column [<column_name>] in table [<table_name>]

  • update - When Hibernate find a new field in Entity, it will update the DB with null values. But if some field will be removedd from Entity - DB's table will not be updated

  • create - Every time when you start App, Hibernate will delete DB and create a new one

  • create-drop - same as create but also you are able to delete DB when SessionFactory will be closed.

For example:

SessionFactory sessionFactory = new Configuration().configure().buildSessionFactory();
sessionFactory.close();
